oai_dc:dc.dc:title: BRAGG REFLECTION OF SHALLOW-WATER WAVES ON A SLOPING BEACH
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cho, Yong-Sik
Lee, Jong-In
Lee, Jong-Kyu
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: sloping beach
shallow water
Bragg reflection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this study a set of governing equations describing the evolution of modulated shallow-water waves over a sinusoidally varying topography on a sloping beach is derived. The governing equations include the nonlinear interactions among different wave components as well as the shoaling effect over a slowly varying topography. It has been shown that the incident waves could be resonantly reflected by the interaction with the rippled seabed under the Bragg reflection condition. The magnitude of the resonantly reflected wave is almost equal to those of the incident and the transmitted waves.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 25 (1996): Proceedings of 25th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Orlando, Florida, 1996.
